items.displayName: The user wants to create a main orchestrator workflow that can be started manually.
The user wants to wrap the entire workflow in a Try-Catch block to handle and log any potential errors.
Read the configuration data from the "Settings" sheet of the Excel file located at C:\FraudDetection\Config\config.xlsx and store it in the dtConfig DataTable.
Extract the API URL from the "Value" column of the first row of the dtConfig DataTable and store it in the strAPIUrl variable.
Log an informational message indicating the start of the fraud detection automation process.
Invoke the "ExtractTransactionData.xaml" workflow to get the transaction data and store it in the dtTransactions DataTable.
Log the number of transactions that have been loaded.
Invoke the "CallFraudDetectionAPI.xaml" workflow, passing the transaction data and API URL as input, and receiving the updated transactions and the count of fraudulent transactions as output.
Log the number of fraudulent transactions that were detected.
Invoke the "ProcessFlaggedTransactions.xaml" workflow, passing the transaction data and receiving the flagged transactions as output.
Invoke the "GenerateComplianceReport.xaml" workflow, passing the transaction data, flagged transactions, and fraud count to generate a compliance report.
Invoke the "SendAlerts.xaml" workflow, passing the fraud count and flagged transactions to send out necessary alerts.
Invoke the "NotifyAuthorities.xaml" workflow, passing the flagged transactions to notify the relevant authorities.
Log a final message indicating the completion of the fraud detection process, including the total number of transactions and the number of fraudulent transactions found.
